```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
# This code creates the wed[ages of all pairs, and how their extreme returns and swings are filtered by news. Plus it returns the list of Critical news and days with crtiical news. "Critical news" file can be used in the actual bot to 
# filter incoming critical news. The list of critical ays is used in the optimization to check fot he effects of removing days with crtiical news to be used as filter in the optimization of robots, as part of the money managmente, safity procedures.
#In includes the days before, during and after the news.

#library(sqldf)
library(purrr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(Stocks)
library(zoo)
library(data.table)

MinDDWanted=2 #percent of account wanted to be at maximum DD for this pair. 
ZigZagDDWated=2 #largest etesion in price used for sqing selection...used smaller than the returns DD wated..
PerCorrection=0.25 #Percent of correction tested. This is used to calcualte zigzag of this size of large. Basically, times when market extended before having a correction of this size
FreqNewExc=10     #Percent frequency above which news are excluded. some news like crude oil reports aer reporeted each week, byt the sheer number they can coincide with critical events.

ForexData=fread("D:/Scrips/Trading/ForexPairs2YrsAll.csv") #ForexPairs2YrsAll  ForexPairs2Months.csv
ForexData=ForexData %>% rename("X" = "V1")


###############################################################################################################################
########---------------START-------------------NEWS for swings---------------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################
    News=read.csv("D:/Scrips/Trading/OptiMoraR/ForexNewsData.csv")
    News$From=as.Date(News$DateUTC,  format ="%Y-%m-%d")
    News=News[, c("currency", "event", "impact","From") ]
    News$To=News$From
    News$Ocurrence="_D_"
    News$Day=lubridate::wday(News$From, week_start=1)
    News$OcurrenceRank=1 #used to rank the different filters (e.g. same day(1)), before (2), after(2), or all beforeduring and after(3), in cases when the results of the filters are the same. Best is 1
      
      DayAfter=DayBefore=DayBeforeAfter=News
      
    #Range for same day and day after
      DayAfter$Ocurrence="_DA"
      DayAfter$To <- fifelse(DayAfter$Day >= 5, DayAfter$From+(7-DayAfter$Day+1), DayAfter$From+1) #if news annoument done from friday to Sunday, then block Monday trading
      DayAfter$OcurrenceRank=2
    #Range for same day and day after
      DayBefore$Ocurrence="BD_"
      DayBefore$From <- fifelse(DayBefore$Day == 1 , DayBefore$To-3, fifelse(DayBefore$Day == 7 , DayBefore$To-2, DayBefore$To-1))#if news announcement done from Saturday to Monday, then block Friday trading
      DayBefore$OcurrenceRank=2
    #Range for before, same, and after day of news announcement
      DayBeforeAfter$Ocurrence="BDA"
      DayBeforeAfter$From <- DayBefore$From
      DayBeforeAfter$To   <- DayAfter$To
      DayBeforeAfter$OcurrenceRank=3
      
     News= do.call("rbind", list(DayAfter,DayBefore,DayBeforeAfter,News))

###############################################################################################################################
########---------------end---------------------NEWS for swings---------------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################

#Set WD
Path=dirname(rstudioapi::getSourceEditorContext()$path)
setwd(Path)

########-----------------------------------------FUNCTIONS-------------------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################

PlotReturnsByNews <- function(Ticker, Date,Change,News){

          DataI=data.frame(Date=Date, Change=Change)
        #news for given pair
          News1=News %>% filter(currency == substr(Ticker, 1, 3))
          News2=News %>% filter(currency == substr(Ticker, 4, 6))
        
          NewsI=rbind(News1,News2) #Concantenate news from both pairs
       
        #Merge
          ReturnNewsI= left_join(DataI,NewsI, join_by(between(Date, From, To)))
          
        #Returns by news type...resume the variation in return when each news is reported
          ReturnNewsI =ReturnNewsI %>% group_by(event) %>% summarise(MinChange = min(Change, na.rm=T),MaxChange = max(Change, na.rm=T))
        
          ReturnNewsI=data.frame(ReturnNewsI)
          ReturnNewsI$MinChange=round(ReturnNewsI$MinChange,2)
          ReturnNewsI$MaxChange=round(ReturnNewsI$MaxChange,2)
          ReturnNewsI=ReturnNewsI %>% arrange(desc(MaxChange))
          ReturnNewsI$Rank=(1:nrow(ReturnNewsI))
          ReturnNewsI$Critical=ifelse(abs(ReturnNewsI$MaxChange)>=MinDDWanted, "Yes","No")
          
          ReturnNewsI <- na.omit(ReturnNewsI)
          
          Plot_ReturnRangeByNews = plot_ly(ReturnNewsI, x = ~Rank, xend = ~Rank, y = ~MinChange, yend = ~MaxChange, 
                  text = ~event, hoverinfo = "event") %>% 
            add_segments(color = ~Critical,
                         colors = c("Yes" = "red", "No" = "blue")) %>% 
                  layout(
                   showlegend = F,
                   plot_bgcolor="rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)",
                   xaxis = list(
                     title ="",
                     zerolinecolor = '#ffff',
                     zerolinewidth = 2,
                     gridcolor = "rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)",
                     tickvals = ReturnNewsI$Rank, ticktext = ReturnNewsI$event,
                     tickfont = list(size = 7) 
                   ),
                   yaxis = list(
                     title ="Range of Daily Returns (%)",
                     zerolinecolor = '#ffff',
                     zerolinewidth = 2)
                  )%>%
                add_segments(x = 0, xend = max(ReturnNewsI$Rank), y = MinDDWanted, yend = MinDDWanted, color=I("red"), line = list(dash = 'dot')) 
        
          
          return(Plot_ReturnRangeByNews)
          
        }
  


#################################################################################################################################
#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------###
###----START-------------------------------------Funtion Effect of filtering critical changes---------------------------------###
#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------###
#################################################################################################################################

PlotFilteringNews <- function(Ticker, Date,Change,News, CriticalThreshold, YHover, YAxisName, ExcludeFreqNewsAbovePerc){

  
         DataI=data.frame(Date=Date, Change=Change)
         TradingDays=nrow(DataI)
         
        #news for given pair
          CurrencyNameA=substr(Ticker, 1, 3)
          News1=News %>% filter(currency == CurrencyNameA )
       
          
          CurrencyNameB=substr(Ticker, 4, 6)
          News2=News %>% filter(currency == CurrencyNameB)
        
        
          NewsTickerI=rbind(News1,News2) #Concantenate news from both pairs
          NewsTickerI$Name=NewsTickerI$event
          NewsTickerI$event=paste0("(", NewsTickerI$currency, "/", NewsTickerI$Ocurrence, ") ",NewsTickerI$event) #unique name...same news can be in frames (before, After, etc)
                       
                       
        ##remove frequent news. Frequent news can exclude critical days by their sheer occurence
         FreqNews =NewsTickerI %>% group_by(event) %>% summarise(Frequency=n())
         FreqNews$Fraction=FreqNews$Frequency/TradingDays*100
         FreqNews=FreqNews %>% filter(Fraction<=ExcludeFreqNewsAbovePerc) 
         
         NewsTickerI=NewsTickerI %>% filter(event %in% FreqNews$event)
         
        #Merge database of news occurences with days in which trading occured. Matching news to change: returns or zigzags
          ReturnNewsI= left_join(DataI,NewsTickerI, join_by(between(Date, From, To)))
          
          
        #Starting results
          NcriticalDays=sum(DataI$Change >= CriticalThreshold)
          StartMaxDD=round(max(DataI$Change, na.rm=TRUE),2)
          Results=data.frame(NewsI="Total",CriticalLeft=NcriticalDays, MaxDDLeft=StartMaxDD, DaysLeft=TradingDays) #Starting conditions
          
        #list of crtiical news..it should loop only over this list,...the other news are not important
        CriticalDays=ReturnNewsI %>% filter(abs(Change) >=CriticalThreshold) #Select crtical days
        NewsEvents=unique(CriticalDays$event)

        
        TemporaryResults=data.frame(NewsI=as.character(),CriticalLeft=as.numeric(),MaxDDLeft=as.numeric(), DaysLeft=as.numeric(),OccurenceRank=as.numeric())
        NewsToRemove=c()
        
        if(length(NewsEvents)==0){Count=1}else{Count=0}
        while (Count==0){
          for (NewsI in NewsEvents){
            DaysWithNewsI = ReturnNewsI %>% filter(event %in% c(NewsI,NewsToRemove )) #fill all days the news was reported, regardless of the effect
            OccurenceRank=min(DaysWithNewsI $OcurrenceRank) #Collect the news rank, used later to select cases when aefefct are the same, best to select cases with fewer reductions of days
            DaysWithNewsI=unique(DaysWithNewsI$Date) #list of unique days when news were reported
            DaysWithNewsI=data.frame(Date=DaysWithNewsI, CriticalNews="Yes") #Label dates when news were reported as YES.
            DaysWithNewsI=merge(DataI,DaysWithNewsI, all.x=TRUE, by="Date")  #merge days in which news was reported with the list of all dates
            DaysWithNewsI$CriticalNews[is.na(DaysWithNewsI$CriticalNews)] <- "No" #Mark days in which the news was not reported as NO
            
            DaysWithNewsI =DaysWithNewsI %>% group_by(CriticalNews) %>% summarise(CriticalLeft=sum(Change >= CriticalThreshold), MaxDDLeft = max(Change, na.rm=T),  DaysLeft=n()) #summarize results for days with and without the news reported
            
            Vals=filter(DaysWithNewsI,CriticalNews=="No")
            Vals$CriticalNews =NULL
            
            TemporaryResults=rbind(TemporaryResults,cbind(NewsI,Vals, OccurenceRank))
          }
          
          TemporaryResults=TemporaryResults %>% dplyr::arrange(CriticalLeft)
          
          #Chose the ones that remove the most critical days while leaving the most days to trade
          BestRemoval=TemporaryResults %>% filter(CriticalLeft ==min(CriticalLeft))
          BestRemoval=BestRemoval %>% filter(DaysLeft ==max(DaysLeft))
          BestRemoval=BestRemoval %>% dplyr::arrange(OccurenceRank)
          BestRemoval$OccurenceRank=NULL
          BestRemoval=BestRemoval[1,]
          NewsToRemove=c(NewsToRemove, BestRemoval$NewsI)
          Results=rbind(Results,BestRemoval)
         if(length(NewsEvents)==length(unique(Results$NewsI))-1){Count=1} #Stop if there are no more critical news to filter
         if(min(Results$CriticalLeft)==0){Count=1}                             #or if all critical values are filtered
        }
        

        #Collect critical days not filtered
            ListOfImportantNews=unique(Results$NewsI)
            DaysOfImportantNews = ReturnNewsI %>% filter(event %in% ListOfImportantNews)
            if(nrow(DaysOfImportantNews)>=1){
            DaysOfImportantNews=unique(DaysOfImportantNews$Date)
            DaysOfImportantNews=data.frame(Date=DaysOfImportantNews,Occurence="YES")
            DaysOfImportantNews=merge(DataI,DaysOfImportantNews, all.x=TRUE, by="Date")
            DaysOfImportantNews$Occurence[is.na(DaysOfImportantNews$Occurence)] <- "NO"
            FilteredDaysOfImportantNews = DaysOfImportantNews %>% filter(Occurence=="NO" & Change>=CriticalThreshold)
            NonFilterCriticalReturn=FilteredDaysOfImportantNews[,c("Date", "Change")] #list of criticl returns that were not filtered
            }else{NonFilterCriticalReturn=data.frame(Date=NA,Change=NA)}
            
            
            
        
        
        Results$Rank=1:nrow(Results)
        
        MaxDays=length(Date)
        Results$DaysLeft=round((Results$DaysLeft/MaxDays)*100,0)
        Y3Name=paste0("Trading Days Left (in Percent of ",MaxDays, " days")
        #plot relationship bwetween news and retruns
        CriticalRemovalPlot=Stocks::Plot3YAxis(X=Results$Rank,
                                      Y1=Results$CriticalLeft,
                                      Y2=round(Results$MaxDDLeft,1),
                                      Y3=Results$DaysLeft,
                                      
                                      XNames=Results$NewsI,
                                      
                                      Y1AxisName=YAxisName,
                                      Y2AxisName="Maximum DropDown Left",
                                      Y3AxisName=Y3Name,
                                      
                                      Y1HoverName =YHover,
                                      Y2HoverName="LeftMaxDD",
                                      Y3HoverName="LeftGoodDays"
                                    )
        
        ListOfCriticalNews=merge(Results, NewsTickerI, by.x="NewsI", by.y="event", all.x=TRUE)
        ListOfCriticalNews=unique(ListOfCriticalNews$Name)
        ListOfCriticalNews <- ListOfCriticalNews[!is.na(ListOfCriticalNews)]
        DaysOfImportantNews$Change=NULL
        DaysWhenCriticalNewsReported=DaysOfImportantNews
        RETURN=list(CriticalRemovalPlot,NonFilterCriticalReturn ,ListOfCriticalNews, DaysWhenCriticalNewsReported)
        
        return(RETURN)
        }

###----------END---------------------------------Funtion Effect of filtering critical changes---------------------------------###
#################################################################################################################################








###############################################################################################################################
########---------------start---------------------DATA for daily returns------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################

Daility=ForexData[TF=="1 day", ]
Daility$Return=abs(Daility$h-Daility$l)/Daility$l*100 #Calcaulte returns as

Daility=Daility[,c(  "Date",    "Return","TickerNam")]
Daility$Date=as.Date(Daility$Date,  format ="%Y-%m-%d")

########---------------end-----------------------DATA for daily returns------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################





###############################################################################################################################
########---------------start---------------------DATA for swings-------------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################
## Swings are calcualte on 1 minute candle data, then for each day the maximum swings is calcualted. The idea is to create the 
## same data format as in the returns so the same fucntion for ploting can be used. When no swings ocurs value is set to 0

ForexData=ForexData[TF=="1 min", ]
ForexData[,c("o", "h","l", "v","TF")]=NULL


PAIRS=unique(Daility$TickerNam)
SwingsData=data.frame()
for ( I in PAIRS){
    DataI=ForexData[TickerNam==I, ] #Select data for pair I
    
    SizeSwinsI=ZigZag_Frequency.Swings(DataI$c,change=PerCorrection) #Calculate size of swings for a given correction
    
    SwingsI=data.frame(Swings=ZigZag_Swings.Points(DataI$c,change=PerCorrection)) #Price point at which the swing occured. used to find the Candle where the swin happend
    
    
    SwingsI$X=DataI$X
    SwingsI=na.omit(SwingsI) 
    SwingsI=SwingsI[1:(nrow(SwingsI)-1),] #To select the start position of the  swings, the last row needs to be removed
    
    SwingsI$SizeSwins=SizeSwinsI #Apend the position of swins to their size
    SwingsI$Swings=NULL
    
    SwingsI=merge(DataI, SwingsI, by="X", all.x=TRUE)
    
    SwingsI$Date=as.Date(SwingsI$Date,  format ="%Y-%m-%d")
    SwingsI <- SwingsI %>% mutate(SizeSwins = ifelse(is.na(SizeSwins), 0, SizeSwins)) #candles that did not get any swings are set to cero
    
    SwingsI= SwingsI %>% group_by(Date) %>% summarise(MaxSwin = max(SizeSwins, na.rm=T)) #Get maximum swins in every day day
    
    SwingsI$TickerNam=I
      
    SwingsData=rbind(SwingsData, SwingsI)
    }

#Remove data not needed t clear RAM.
rm(ForexData, DataI)

SwingsData=as.data.frame(SwingsData)

###############################################################################################################################
########---------------end---------------------DATA for swings---------------------------------------------------------########
###############################################################################################################################










###############################################################################################################################
###-------------------------------------------------Create Plot-------------------------------------------------------------###
###############################################################################################################################

CriticalNewsByPair=c()
DaysWithCriticalNewsByPair=c()
CriticalNewsByPair_SwinsOnly=c() # a smaller subject of the news, which cold increase the amount of time to trade.
DaysWithCriticalNewsByPair_SwinsOnly=c()

#Returns by news event
for (TickerX in PAIRS){
  
#Plot returns by news  
    Subset=Daility[TickerNam==TickerX, ]
    Date=Subset$Date
    Change=Subset$Return
    NewsTickerX = News %>% filter(Ocurrence %in% "_D_")
    NewsTickerX$event=paste0("(",NewsTickerX$currency,") ",NewsTickerX$event)
    Plot=PlotReturnsByNews(TickerX, Date=Date, Change=Change,News=NewsTickerX)

#Plot effect on returns of filtering news
    YName=paste0("Critical Returns Left at ",MinDDWanted ,"% in ", TickerX)
    Returns=PlotFilteringNews (Ticker=TickerX, Date=Date, Change=Change,News=News, CriticalThreshold=MinDDWanted, YHover="CritReturnsLeft",YAxisName=YName, FreqNewExc)


#Plot effect on swings of filtering news
    SwingsData=as.data.table(SwingsData)
    SubsetSwing=SwingsData[TickerNam==TickerX, ]
    
    DateSwings=SubsetSwing$Date
    ChangeSwings=SubsetSwing$MaxSwin
    
    YName=paste0("Critical Swings Left at ",ZigZagDDWated ,"% in ", TickerX)
    Swings=PlotFilteringNews (Ticker=TickerX, Date=DateSwings, Change=ChangeSwings,News=News, CriticalThreshold=ZigZagDDWated, YHover="CritSwingsLeft",YAxisName=YName, FreqNewExc)

assign(paste0("ReturnRangeByNews_",TickerX), Plot)
assign(paste0("CriticalReturns_",TickerX), Returns[[1]])
assign(paste0("NonFiltereReturns_",TickerX), Returns[[2]])
assign(paste0("CriticalSwings_",TickerX), Swings[[1]])
assign(paste0("NonFiltereSwings_",TickerX), Swings[[2]])

#compile list of crtiical news by each pair...given both citical retruns and swings
    NameCriticalNews=c(Returns[[3]],Swings[[3]])
    if(!is_empty(NameCriticalNews)){NewsCritic=data.frame(Ticker=TickerX, NameCriticalNews); CriticalNewsByPair=rbind(CriticalNewsByPair, NewsCritic)}
    
    
  
##############list of news and days with critical swins only. Used to potentailly increase number of dates tradings
    #compile list of crtiical news by each pair...given both citical retruns and swings
    NameCriticalNews_Swings=c(Swings[[3]])
    if(!is_empty(NameCriticalNews_Swings)){NewsCritic_Swings=data.frame(Ticker=TickerX, NameCriticalNews_Swings); CriticalNewsByPair_SwinsOnly=rbind(CriticalNewsByPair_SwinsOnly, NewsCritic_Swings)}
      }

write.csv(CriticalNewsByPair, "CriticalNews_ListByPair.csv")


write.csv(CriticalNewsByPair_SwinsOnly, "CriticalNews_ListByPair_SwingsOnly.csv")


```



Below we show the effect of news releases on daily returns and swings. 
</br>
Critical returns are defined as days when the price range was larger than ``r MinDDWanted``% daily.
</br>
Critical swings are defined as times when price corrections larger than ``r   PerCorrection`` did not occurred after price extensions larger than ``r   ZigZagDDWated``%. Basically, the price got extended by up to ``r   ZigZagDDWated``% before there was a correction of ``r   PerCorrection``%.
